title: Development and Validation of a Situational Interest Measurement Tool for Elementary English Learners: Pre-Service Teacher Capacity-Building Workshop

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational English teaching methods for elementary education, understanding of reflective journaling techniques, and basic statistical analysis knowledge
context.additional_context: Workshop where pre-service teachers develop and validate situational interest measurement tools applicable to real classrooms while cultivating smartphone-centric resource utilization skills in limited-technology environments

learning_goals: Learners can derive three core elements of situational interest for elementary English learners by analyzing reflective journaling data.
Learners can explain the procedure for validating the validity of measurement tools using confirmatory factor analysis (CFA).
Learners can create learner interest profiles using the developed 10-item tool and propose educational improvement strategies.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
